intro: Achillea jacea, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lance-shaped and gray-green in color, often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters called umbels. Achillea jacea is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, and it has been used historically for its medicinal properties.
